title: The Six Base Spirits
subtitle: Brandy, Gin, Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Whiskey

intro.text: Among the many distilled spirits available, there are just six base liquors: brandy, gin, rum, tequila, vodka, and whiskey. While distilled using similar methods, each is unique in flavor, and there are distinct styles within each category.

sections.name: Brandy
sections.description: Brandy is often enjoyed on its own. It's popularly featured in several classic cocktails and tends to be used in drinks that include just a few ingredients.

facts.label: Flavor Profile
facts.value: Fruity burnt wine with a pleasant oakiness

facts.label: Aged
facts.value: Varies by style, typically aged in oak

facts.label: Styles
facts.value: Cognac, Armagnac, Spanish Brandy, Pisco, American Brandy, Grappa, Eau-de-vie, Flavored Brandy

facts.label: Regulations
facts.value: No distinct worldwide regulations; some regional rules apply

sections.name: Gin
sections.description: Gin is a spirit flavored with juniper berries and other botanicals. Its dry profile makes it perfect for martinis and other classic cocktails.

facts.label: Distilled From
facts.value: Neutral grains such as barley, corn, rye, wheat

facts.label: Styles
facts.value: London Dry, Plymouth, Old Tom, Genever, New American

sections.name: Rum
sections.description: Rum's sweeter flavor makes it versatile and ideal for tropical and warm cocktails.

facts.label: Flavor Profile
facts.value: Sweet toasted sugar taste, varies by style and region

facts.label: Aged
facts.value: Light rum usually unaged; dark rums aged in oak

facts.label: Styles
facts.value: Light, Gold, Dark, Overproof, Spiced, Cachaça, Flavored

facts.label: Regulations
facts.value: Some styles have regional laws; no universal rules

sections.name: Tequila
sections.description: Tequila mixes well in cocktails like margaritas and spicy drinks, made from fermented agave.

facts.label: Aged
facts.value: Blanco: unaged; Reposado & Añejo: aged in barrels

facts.label: Regulations
facts.value: Strictly regulated by Appellation of Origin; CRT oversight

sections.name: Vodka
sections.description: Vodka is neutral, versatile, and forms the base of countless sweet and savory cocktails.

facts.label: Distilled From
facts.value: Grains or potatoes, sometimes beets or grapes

facts.label: Flavor Profile
facts.value: Neutral, varies by base and distillation method

sections.name: Whiskey
sections.description: Whiskey is versatile, used in cocktails and neat, with styles influenced by grains and regions.

facts.label: Distilled From
facts.value: Malted grains: corn, rye, wheat, barley

facts.label: Flavor Profile
facts.value: Roasted, malted grain with oak undertones

facts.label: Produced In
facts.value: Worldwide; styles often defined by country/region

facts.label: Styles
facts.value: Bourbon, Canadian, Irish, Japanese, Rye, Scotch, Tennessee, Blended, Flavored

facts.label: Regulations
facts.value: Varies by country; some styles tightly regulated
